episode_summary: This episode covers a range of fascinating topics including historical train travel, Ernest Shackleton's expeditions and his dogs, theories about the construction of Stonehenge, and the unique Pando tree in Utah.

facts.fact: Before trains had corridors, guards had to climb along the outside of the carriage to check your ticket.
Ernest Shackleton's dog's names included slippery sloppers, satin, painful, swanker, bummer, and bob.
According to a recent theory, Stonehenge was built as part of a team building exercise.
Utah has a 106-acre forest that's made out of one tree.
